title: Would anyone be sad if zed got the Kassadin treatment?
body: Like right now I wouldn't give two shits if zed was nerfed to the point of  uselessness. He is so un-fun to play against and I'm honestly sick and tired of seeing him every normal game I play.

replies.body: all the zed mains "i put effort into landing his q so i deserve a broken champ" kids be bitching for a week.

He's strong enough that you could remove his ult, and he will still dominate lane.

I mean how many times have we all QSS/Glass'd a Zed ult, evading the mark, and dying to him anyway?

I was playing ashe, there was a 5/1 zed with decent CS. And he killed me with a shadow, double Q, an E and 1 auto with thunderlords proc. He didn't need to ult at all.

There are actual champions that could be put near the realm of old kassadin.

Zed is completely far from anywhere near old kassadin, when Zed manages to get pick/banned in the lcs every single game for ages then you can think about it.

learn what broken means.

actually, you don't know what broken means.

broken is a character that negatively affects game health. in the case of zed it's a kit issue. its called broken as it effectively breaks something. in the case of zed, he is blatantly hurting game lifespan. as more players get sick of him, players have started quitting. getting sick of course applies to those that play him as a foo strategy, and then find that he is actually the best that they will find of that class.

broken of course can be applied to lots of things, it is a very general term. whenever you see it tossed around, think, how is that thing affecting game health.

interesting, instead of coming up with something that could be an indication of me being wrong in any way you have said very clearly that you are a pathetic person undeserving of any worthwhile attention. at least you were clear about that much.

While Zed is strong he differs from old kassadin in many ways. Zed is much more interesting, and when playing against a zed there is always outplay potential. Old Kassadin could make a mistake but be ok since he had a long silence while being more mobile doing similar damage and having a stronger ult overall since the cooldown was low.
I find it fun to play against him especially as Lux because it's a challenge, but maybe that's just me.
